com.systemj.netapi

Class SimpleClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.systemj.netapi.OutputSignal
      • com.systemj.netapi.SimpleClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class SimpleClient
extends OutputSignal

    This class is used to transmit data to the input signal that implements com.systemj.ipc.SimpleServer

    Usage example: 

     
 SimpleClient s = new SimpleClient("127.0.0.1", 2000, "CD1", "I");
 s.emit("val", 2000); // Emitting a String "val" for 2 seconds
 s.close(); // close when necessary

      Constructor and Description
      SimpleClient(String ip, int port, String cdName, String sigName)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleClient

        public SimpleClient(String ip,
                    int port,
                    String cdName,
                    String sigName)
             throws IOException
        Parameters:
        ip - the hostname specified for the com.systemj.ipc.SimpleServer.
        port - the port number for the com.systemj.ipc.SimpleServer.
        cdName - the name of the receiving clock-domain.
        sigName - the name of the input signal.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating a socket.
